senses.sense_definition: Very pale, usually because of illness, shock, or fear.

examples.text: She went <w>ashen</w> when the police arrived at her door with the news.
His <w>ashen</w> face revealed the terror he felt during the incident.

senses.sense_definition: Resembling ashes in color or texture; grey and powdery.

examples.text: The volcano spewed a thick, <w>ashen</w> cloud into the summer sky.
Everything in the abandoned room was covered in a fine <w>ashen</w> dust.

senses.sense_definition: Made from the wood of the ash tree.

examples.text: The warrior carried a sturdy <w>ashen</w> spear into the battle.
They sat upon old <w>ashen</w> benches in the great hall.

traits.comment: mostly found in older literature or poetic contexts

senses.sense_definition: To become pale, typically due to strong emotion or shock.

examples.text: His face <w>ashened</w> visibly as he realized the gravity of his mistake.
The sky <w>ashened</w> as the winter storm approached the valley.

senses.sense_definition: To reduce to ashes or become like ash.

examples.text: The intense heat <w>ashened</w> the paper almost instantly.
The logs <w>ashened</w> slowly in the dying fire of the hearth.
